review **spoiler alert** I almost didn't make it past the baby left in the bookstore because that seemed so stupid but I picked it up again and read it in on **spoiler alert** I almost didn't make it past the baby left in the bookstore because that seemed so stupid but I picked it up again and read it in one day. Figured out where it was going on page 129 and was devastated, much akin to the final season of "How I Met Your Mother." Only issue I had was with the timeline- it just doesn't feel like it happens over an twenty year span. ...more

review Kind of frightening that a story about a family hacked up in a supposed satanic ritual killing has less dysfunctional characters than her other book Kind of frightening that a story about a family hacked up in a supposed satanic ritual killing has less dysfunctional characters than her other book about a missing person. review Like its author, Famous All Over Town is spastic and vulgar, but also funny and endearing. The novel is a series of poignant vignettes about the resid Like its author, Famous All Over Town is spastic and vulgar, but also funny and endearing. The novel is a series of poignant vignettes about the residents of the "fictional" Lowcountry town of Beau.. Oops, I mean Somerset. Bernie knows and loves all of these characters and spins their tales as only Bernie can. ...more
